comments.creator: brian@briansmith.org
comments.author: brian@briansmith.org
comments.text: libssl pervasively uses %d as printf format specifier for pointers (e.g. ss->fd) instead of %p, e.g. in calls to SSL_DBG and SSL_TRC. This will cause a problem when sizeof(void*) != sizeof(int).
comments.raw_text: libssl pervasively uses %d as printf format specifier for pointers (e.g. ss->fd) instead of %p, e.g. in calls to SSL_DBG and SSL_TRC. This will cause a problem when sizeof(void*) != sizeof(int).
